net.asrex.skillful.perk

Class PerkRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.asrex.skillful.perk.PerkRegistry

  • public class PerkRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    A central, static registry for all PerkDefinition instances.

    Note that this must be initialized via the init(java.io.File) method after the SkillRegistry has been initialized.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(java.io.File configDir)
                 throws java.io.IOException

      • register

        public static void register(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.Class<? extends EffectDefinition> clazz)
        Registers an effect with the given name. Names should be all lower-case and consist only of letters a-z and underscores ('_').

        Effect names are used in the perks configuration to instantiate instances of their associated EffectDefinition object. Note that they will implicitly be prefixed with '!' in configuration file.

        Third-party effects, requirements, and costs should be registered at startup during the FMLInitializationEvent. Perk configuration will be read from disk during the FMLPostInitializationEvent, and any missing definitions will result in an error.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the effect
        clazz - the EffectDefinition class to register

      • registerRequirement

        public static void registerRequirement(java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.Class<? extends Requirement> requirementType)
        Registers a perk requirement provider. Names should be all lower-case and consist only of letters a-z and underscores ('_').

        Requirements are used in the perks configuration to create instances of their associated Requirement object. Note that they will implicitly be prefixed with '!' in configuration file.

        Third-party effects, requirements, and costs should be registered at startup during the FMLInitializationEvent. Perk configuration will be read from disk during the FMLPostInitializationEvent, and any missing definitions will result in an error.

        Parameters:
        name - the name for the configuration tag to associate with the given class
        requirementType - the class to associate with the given tag name

      • registerCost

        public static void registerCost(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.Class<? extends PerkCost> costType)
        Registers a perk cost provider. Names should be all lower-case and consist only of letters a-z and underscores ('_').

        Costs are used in the perks configuration to create instances of their associated PerkCost object. Note that names will implicitly be prefixed with a '!' character in configuration files.

        Third-party effects, requirements, and costs should be registered at startup during the FMLInitializationEvent. Perk configuration will be read from disk during the FMLPostInitializationEvent, and any missing definitions will result in an error.

        Parameters:
        name - the name for the configuration tag to associate with the given class
        costType - the class to associate with the given tag name

      • registerPack

        public static void registerPack(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.Class<? extends PerkPack> clazz)
        Registers a perk pack provider with the given name. Names should be all lower-case and consist only of letters a-z and underscores ('_').

        Perk packs are used in the perk configuration to allow users to add preconfigured collections of perks in bulk. For additional information and requirements for perk pack implementations, see PerkPack. Note that names will implicitly be prefixed with '!' character in configuration file.

        Third-party perk packs should be registered at startup during the FMLInitializationEvent. Perk configuration will be read from disk during the FMLPostInitializationEvent, and any missing definitions at this time will result in an error.

        Parameters:
        name - the name for the configuration tag to associate with the given class
        clazz - the class of the perk pack to register

      • getPacks

        public static java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<? extends PerkPack>> getPacks()

      • getAvailablePerks

        public static java.util.List<PerkDefinition> getAvailablePerks(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player,
                                               boolean eligibleOnly,
                                               boolean affordableOnly)
        Locates all perks definitions that the given player does not have but whose requirements are (optionally) fully met and costs can be (optionally) afforded.

        Note that this method is currently usable on the server.

        Parameters:
        player - the player for which to retrieve matching perks
        eligibleOnly - if true, only include results whose requirements are fully met
        affordableOnly - if true, only include results the player can afford
        Returns:
        a list of matching perk definitions, if any exist

      • createEffect

        public static Effect createEffect(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player,
                  java.lang.String perkName,
                  java.lang.String effectName)
        Attempts to create and initialize a new Effect instance for the given player using the given uniquely-identifying perk and effect name.

        This method will perform the initialization steps as described in the class documentation for Effect, but will not enable the effect. It should first be added to the player, and then activated on both the client and server concurrently (see PlayerNetworkHelper.addAndActivateEffect(EntityPlayer, String, String) for an alternative method that will perform these remaining steps for you.

        Parameters:
        player - the player to set as the parent for the effect
        perkName - the name of the effect's parent perk, used to uniquely identify the effect's EffectDefinition.
        effectName - the name of the effect
        Returns:
        the effect if a matching effect definition could be found, or null

      • createEffectFromSlugs

        public static Effect createEffectFromSlugs(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player,
                           java.lang.String perkSlug,
                           java.lang.String effectSlug)
        An alternative implementation of createEffect(EntityPlayer, String, String) that uses slugs for querying, suitable for usage with text commands. The perkSlug and effectSlug parameters are assumed already be in "slug" form; in particular, case sensitivity is enforced and the input strings should already be all-lowercase.
        Parameters:
        player - the player to set as the parent for the effect
        perkSlug - the perk name slug to query
        effectSlug - the effect name slug to query
        Returns:
        the effect if a matching effect definition could be found, or null
        See Also:
        TextUtil.slugify(java.lang.String), createEffect(EntityPlayer, String, String)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
